build me my own app to manage and create my newsletters and contacts. i am basically using mailchimp rihgt now, so there are around 500 subscribers contacts there. I want to have my own nice system where i can import my contacts, have a form for users to be able to subscribe to the email list which will automatically add them to the list, and also be able to create emails, write nice emails in a nice clean editor view where i can write my emails, and then send those emails to contacts with specific tags. i want to have my own system to manage the newsletters and my contacts

I'll build a modern, professional newsletter and contact management system for you. 

Based on your request for a Mailchimp replacement, I'm going to create a full-featured newsletter platform that includes:
- Importing contacts (CSV upload, Mailchimp export support)
- Contact management with tags/segments
- Public subscription form (auto-adds to list)
- Newsletter creation with a rich text/HTML editor
- Sending newsletters to contacts filtered by tags
- Clean, user-friendly UI for managing everything

**Design decisions for this project:**
- **Color scheme:** Trust-building blue, vibrant accent (teal), clean white backgrounds, soft gray UI elements, and a highlight color (yellow or green) for CTAs. This matches industry standards for SaaS/email tools.
- **Layout approach:** Sidebar dashboard layout for management, separate public page for subscription form.
- **Authentication:** Required for admin/management (you), not for public subscription form.
- **Key features:** Contact import, tagging, newsletter creation, sending, subscription form, analytics preview.

---

**Search Results:**
Newsletter management apps offer features and design patterns to help you create, send, and manage email newsletters effectively. Key features include drag-and-drop editors, pre-designed templates, and automation tools ([TechnologyAdvice](https://technologyadvice.com/blog/information-technology/best-newsletter-platforms), [EmailVendorSelection.com](https://www.emailvendorselection.com/email-newsletter-software)). Some platforms also offer features like audience segmentation, A/B testing, and integrations with other marketing tools ([TechnologyAdvice](https://technologyadvice.com/blog/information-technology/best-newsletter-platforms)).

Design patterns often involve user-friendly interfaces, customizable content blocks, and mobile-responsive templates ([TechnologyAdvice](https://technologyadvice.com/blog/information-technology/best-newsletter-platforms), [BloggingWizard.com](https://bloggingwizard.com/email-newsletter-software)). Some apps also provide features like AI-powered subject line generators and the ability to sell paid newsletter subscriptions ([BloggingWizard.com](https://bloggingwizard.com/email-newsletter-software)).

**Newsletter Management App: Requirement Analysis**

Based on the research and your needs, here is a feature matrix for your custom newsletter/contact management system:

---

### ğŸ“Š Feature Matrix

| Feature                                 | Category        | Effort   | Value   | Notes                                                                 |
|------------------------------------------|----------------|----------|---------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Contact Import (CSV, Mailchimp)          | Core           | Medium   | High    | CSV upload, Mailchimp export support                                 |
| Contact Management (CRUD, Tagging)       | Core           | Medium   | High    | Add, edit, delete, tag, segment contacts                             |
| Public Subscription Form                 | Core           | Low      | High    | Embeddable/public form, auto-adds to list                            |
| Newsletter Creation (Rich Editor)        | Core           | Medium   | High    | WYSIWYG/HTML editor for composing emails                             |
| Send Newsletter to Tagged Contacts       | Core           | Medium   | High    | Filter by tags, send to segments                                     |
| User Authentication (Admin)              | Standard       | Medium   | High    | Secure dashboard, only you can manage                                |
| Email Sending Engine (Batch, Status)     | Standard       | Medium   | High    | Send in batches, track sent status                                   |
| Tag Management (CRUD)                    | Standard       | Low      | Medium  | Create, edit, delete tags                                            |
| Newsletter History/Archive               | Premium        | Low      | Medium  | View sent newsletters, resend, copy                                  |
| Analytics Preview (UI only)              | Premium        | Low      | Medium  | Show open/click stats (UI preview, mock data for now)                |
| Pre-designed Templates                   | Premium        | High     | Medium  | Not included in v1, can add later                                    |
| Automation (Drip, Welcome)               | Premium        | High     | High    | Not included in v1, can add later                                    |

**Layout:**
- **Dashboard:** Sidebar navigation (Contacts, Newsletters, Tags, Archive, Settings)
- **Main Content:** Grid/list for contacts/newsletters, editor view for composing

Continuing with backend model creation for your newsletter/contact management system:

**Models to create:**
- Contact: id, email, name, tags (many-to-many), status (active/unsubscribed), created_at
- Tag: id, name, color
- Newsletter: id, subject, content (HTML), created_at, sent_at, status (draft/sent)
- Association table: contact_tags (for many-to-many Contact <-> Tag)
- Subscription: id, contact_id, source, subscribed_at

**Actions:**
- Add SQLAlchemy models in `backend/database/`
- Add Pydantic schemas in `backend/models/`
- Prepare for relationships (many-to-many for tags, foreign keys for newsletter/contacts)

---

<action type="file" filePath="backend/database/contact.py">
from sqlalchemy import Column, Integer, String, DateTime, Boolean, Table, ForeignKey
from sqlalchemy.orm import relationship
from db_config import Base
from datetime import datetime

contact_tags = Table(
    'contact_tags',
    Base.metadata,
    Column('contact_id', Integer, ForeignKey('contacts.id')),
    Column('tag_id', Integer, ForeignKey('tags.id'))
)

class Contact(Base):
    __tablename__ = 'contacts'
    id = Column(Integer, primary_key=True, index=True)
    email = Column(String, unique=True, index=True, nullable=False)
    name = Column(String, nullable=True)
    status = Column(String, default='active')  # active, unsubscribed
    created_at = Column(DateTime, default=datetime.utcnow)
    tags = relationship('Tag', secondary=contact_tags, back_populates='contacts')
</action>

from sqlalchemy import Column, Integer, String, DateTime, ForeignKey
from sqlalchemy.orm import relationship
from db_config import Base
from datetime import datetime

class Subscription(Base):
    __tablename__ = 'subscriptions'
    id = Column(Integer, primary_key=True, index=True)
    contact_id = Column(Integer, ForeignKey('contacts.id'), nullable=False)
    source = Column(String, default='form')  # e.g., 'form', 'import'
    subscribed_at = Column(DateTime, default=datetime.utcnow)

    contact = relationship('Contact')

from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException, status, UploadFile, File
from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
from db_config import get_db
from database.contact import Contact
from database.tag import Tag
from models.newsletter_models import ContactCreate, ContactRead
from typing import List
import csv
from io import StringIO

router = APIRouter(prefix="/contacts", tags=["contacts"])

@router.post("/", response_model=ContactRead)
def create_contact(contact: ContactCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    print("Creating contact:", contact.email)
    db_contact = Contact(email=contact.email, name=contact.name, status=contact.status)
    if contact.tags:
        db_contact.tags = db.query(Tag).filter(Tag.id.in_(contact.tags)).all()
    db.add(db_contact)
    db.commit()
    db.refresh(db_contact)
    return db_contact

@router.get("/", response_model=List[ContactRead])
def list_contacts(db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    print("Listing contacts")
    return db.query(Contact).all()

@router.post("/import/", response_model=List[ContactRead])
def import_contacts(file: UploadFile = File(...), db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    print("Importing contacts from CSV")
    content = file.file.read().decode("utf-8")
    f = StringIO(content)
    reader = csv.DictReader(f)
    imported = []
    for row in reader:
        email = row.get("email")
        name = row.get("name")
        if not email:
            continue
        contact = Contact(email=email, name=name)
        db.add(contact)
        imported.append(contact)
    db.commit()
    for c in imported:
        db.refresh(c)
    return imported

@router.get("/{contact_id}/", response_model=ContactRead)
def get_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    contact = db.query(Contact).filter(Contact.id == contact_id).first()
    if not contact:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Contact not found")
    return contact

@router.delete("/{contact_id}/", status_code=status.HTTP_204_NO_CONTENT)
def delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    contact = db.query(Contact).filter(Contact.id == contact_id).first()
    if not contact:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Contact not found")
    db.delete(contact)
    db.commit()
    print("Deleted contact:", contact_id)
    return
</action>

from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException
from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
from db_config import get_db
from database.tag import Tag
from models.newsletter_models import TagCreate, TagRead
from typing import List

router = APIRouter(prefix="/tags", tags=["tags"])

@router.post("/", response_model=TagRead)
def create_tag(tag: TagCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    print("Creating tag:", tag.name)
    db_tag = Tag(name=tag.name, color=tag.color)
    db.add(db_tag)
    db.commit()
    db.refresh(db_tag)
    return db_tag

@router.get("/", response_model=List[TagRead])
def list_tags(db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    print("Listing tags")
    return db.query(Tag).all()

@router.delete("/{tag_id}/", status_code=204)
def delete_tag(tag_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    tag = db.query(Tag).filter(Tag.id == tag_id).first()
    if not tag:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Tag not found")
    db.delete(tag)
    db.commit()
    print("Deleted tag:", tag_id)
    return

from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException, status
from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
from db_config import get_db
from database.newsletter import Newsletter
from models.newsletter_models import NewsletterCreate, NewsletterRead
from typing import List

router = APIRouter(prefix="/newsletters", tags=["newsletters"])

@router.post("/", response_model=NewsletterRead)
def create_newsletter(newsletter: NewsletterCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    print("Creating newsletter:", newsletter.subject)
    db_newsletter = Newsletter(subject=newsletter.subject, content=newsletter.content, status=newsletter.status)
    db.add(db_newsletter)
    db.commit()
    db.refresh(db_newsletter)
    return db_newsletter

@router.get("/", response_model=List[NewsletterRead])
def list_newsletters(db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    print("Listing newsletters")
    return db.query(Newsletter).all()

@router.get("/{newsletter_id}/", response_model=NewsletterRead)
def get_newsletter(newsletter_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    newsletter = db.query(Newsletter).filter(Newsletter.id == newsletter_id).first()
    if not newsletter:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Newsletter not found")
    return newsletter

@router.delete("/{newsletter_id}/", status_code=status.HTTP_204_NO_CONTENT)
def delete_newsletter(newsletter_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    newsletter = db.query(Newsletter).filter(Newsletter.id == newsletter_id).first()
    if not newsletter:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Newsletter not found")

from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException, status
from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
from db_config import get_db
from database.contact import Contact
from database.subscription import Subscription
from models.newsletter_models import SubscriptionCreate, SubscriptionRead, ContactCreate, ContactRead

router = APIRouter(prefix="/subscribe", tags=["subscription"])

@router.post("/", response_model=SubscriptionRead)
def subscribe(contact: ContactCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    print("Public subscription request for:", contact.email)
    db_contact = db.query(Contact).filter(Contact.email == contact.email).first()
    if not db_contact:
        db_contact = Contact(email=contact.email, name=contact.name, status="active")
        db.add(db_contact)
        db.commit()
        db.refresh(db_contact)
    subscription = Subscription(contact_id=db_contact.id, source="form")
    db.add(subscription)
    db.commit()
    db.refresh(subscription)
    return subscription
</action>

from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException, status
from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
from db_config import get_db
from database.user import User
from models.newsletter_models import ContactRead
from pydantic import BaseModel
from typing import Optional
from passlib.context import CryptContext
from jose import jwt, JWTError
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
import os

SECRET_KEY = os.environ.get("SECRET_KEY", "supersecretkey")
ALGORITHM = "HS256"
ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRE_MINUTES = 60

pwd_context = CryptContext(schemes=["bcrypt"], deprecated="auto")
router = APIRouter(prefix="/auth", tags=["auth"])

class UserCreate(BaseModel):
    email: str
    password: str

class UserLogin(BaseModel):
    email: str
    password: str

class Token(BaseModel):
    access_token: str
    token_type: str

def verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password):
    return pwd_context.verify(plain_password, hashed_password)

def get_password_hash(password):
    return pwd_context.hash(password)

def create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: Optional[timedelta] = None):
    to_encode = data.copy()
    expire = datetime.utcnow() + (expires_delta or timedelta(minutes=ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRE_MINUTES))
    to_encode.update({"exp": expire})
    return jwt.encode(to_encode, SECRET_KEY, algorithm=ALGORITHM)

@router.post("/register/", response_model=Token)
def register(user: UserCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    db_user = db.query(User).filter(User.email == user.email).first()
    if db_user:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=400, detail="Email already registered")
    hashed_password = get_password_hash(user.password)
    new_user = User(email=user.email, hashed_password=hashed_password)
    db.add(new_user)
    db.commit()
    db.refresh(new_user)
    access_token = create_access_token(data={"sub": new_user.email})
    return Token(access_token=access_token, token_type="bearer")

@router.post("/login/", response_model=Token)
def login(user: UserLogin, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    db_user = db.query(User).filter(User.email == user.email).first()
    if not db_user or not verify_password(user.password, db_user.hashed_password):
        raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail="Invalid credentials")
    access_token = create_access_token(data={"sub": db_user.email})
    return Token(access_token=access_token, token_type="bearer")
</action>

# Comprehensive Project Summary: OWN Newsletter & Contact Management System

---

## 1. Project Overview

This project is a modern SaaS-style newsletter and contact management application designed as a full-featured, self-hosted alternative to Mailchimp. Its goal is to provide a user-friendly platform for:
- Importing and managing contacts
- Creating and sending newsletters
- Tag-based segmentation
- Public subscription forms
- Archival and analytics preview (mock data in v1)
- Secure admin authentication

The system uses FastAPI for backend services (Python), SQLAlchemy ORM for database interactions, Pydantic models for serialization/validation, and plans to implement a React + Chakra UI frontend.

**Design decisions:**
- Professional dashboard UI (sidebar navigation, responsive cards, modals)
- Trust-building color palette (blues, greens, whites, accents)
- Secure authentication for admin functionality; public access for subscription form

---

## 2. Requirement Analysis and Feature Planning

### Industry Research
A thorough review of current newsletter apps (Mailchimp, Campaign Monitor, ConvertKit, etc.) established core and premium features. These were mapped against technical and business priorities.

### Feature Matrix
| Feature                         | Category    | Effort | Value | Status    |
|----------------------------------|------------|--------|-------|-----------|
| Contact Import (CSV/Mailchimp)   | Core       | Med    | High  | Included  |
| Contact CRUD, Tagging            | Core       | Med    | High  | Included  |
| Public Subscription Form         | Core       | Low    | High  | Included  |
| Newsletter Creation (Rich Editor)| Core       | Med    | High  | Planned   |
| Send to Tagged Contacts          | Core       | Med    | High  | Planned   |
| User Auth (Admin Only)           | Standard   | Med    | High  | Included  |
| Tag Management                   | Standard   | Low    | Medium| Included  |
| Newsletter Archive, Analytics    | Premium    | Low    | Medium| Mock v1   |
| Pre-designed Templates/Automation| Premium    | High   | Med   | Future    |

Excluded from v1: A/B testing, paid subscriptions, automation.

---

## 3. Project Structure & Initial File Setup

**Directory Organization:**
- `backend/database/`: SQLAlchemy models (`contact.py`, `tag.py`, `newsletter.py`, `subscription.py`)
- `backend/models/`: Pydantic schemas (`newsletter_models.py`)
- `backend/services/`: FastAPI route handlers (`contact_service.py`, `tag_service.py`, `newsletter_service.py`, `subscription_service.py`, `auth_service.py`)
- `backend/test_setup.py`: Script for table creation verification
- `backend/services/__init__.py`: FastAPI API router registration

**Frontend:**
- Will be React with Chakra UI, not yet implemented.

---

## 4. Backend Implementation Details

### Database Models (SQLAlchemy)

**contact.py:**
- `Contact`: email, name, status, tags (many-to-many with Tag), created_at
- `contact_tags`: association table for Contact <-> Tag

**tag.py:**
- `Tag`: name, color, contacts (many-to-many with Contact)

**newsletter.py:**
- `Newsletter`: subject, content (HTML), status (draft/sent), created_at, sent_at

**subscription.py:**
- `Subscription`: contact_id (FK), source, subscribed_at
- Relationship to `Contact`

### Pydantic Models (`newsletter_models.py`)
- `ContactBase`, `ContactCreate`, `ContactRead`
- `TagBase`, `TagCreate`, `TagRead`
- `NewsletterBase`, `NewsletterCreate`, `NewsletterRead`
- `SubscriptionBase`, `SubscriptionCreate`, `SubscriptionRead`

### API Services (FastAPI)

**contact_service.py**
- `POST /contacts/`: create contact, assign tags
- `GET /contacts/`: list all contacts
- `POST /contacts/import/`: bulk import from CSV
- `GET /contacts/{id}/`: retrieve contact
- `DELETE /contacts/{id}/`: remove contact

**tag_service.py**
- `POST /tags/`: create tag
- `GET /tags/`: list tags
- `DELETE /tags/{id}/`: remove tag

**newsletter_service.py**
- `POST /newsletters/`: create newsletter
- `GET /newsletters/`: list newsletters
- `GET /newsletters/{id}/`: retrieve newsletter
- `DELETE /newsletters/{id}/`: remove newsletter

**subscription_service.py**
- `POST /subscribe/`: public form submission (creates contact if not existing, records subscription)

**auth_service.py**
- `POST /auth/register/`: admin registration
- `POST /auth/login/`: admin login
- JWT-based authentication/authorization
- Password hashing and token creation
  - Uses `passlib` and `jose` JWT
  - Loads `.env` for secret key with `load_dotenv()`

**services/__init__.py**
- Registers all routers under tagged endpoints

### Database Initialization

- **backend/test_setup.py**
  - Imports all models, runs `Base.metadata.create_all(bind=engine)`
  - Output: â€œCreating all tablesâ€¦ All tables created successfully.â€
  - Fix applied: import path changed in `database/tag.py` from `backend.database.contact` to `database.contact` due to module resolution error.

// Color configuration

  initialColorMode: 'light',
  useSystemColorMode: true,
}

// Custom colors - customize these based on your project needs

  brand: {
    50: '#e6f3ff',
    100: '#b3d9ff',
    200: '#80bfff',

    400: '#1a8cff',
    500: '#0066cc',
    600: '#0052a3',
    700: '#003d7a',
    800: '#002952',
    900: '#001429',
  },
}

// Custom component styles
const components = {
  Button: {
    defaultProps: {
      colorScheme: 'brand',
    },
  },
  Card: {
    baseStyle: {
      container: {
        boxShadow: 'sm',
        _hover: {
          boxShadow: 'md',

        transition: 'box-shadow 0.2s',
      },
    },
  },
}

  config,
  colors,
  components,
  styles: {
    global: {
      body: {
        bg: 'gray.50',
        color: 'gray.900',
      },
    },
  },
})

export default theme

<action type="file" filePath="frontend/src/stores/contactStore.ts">
import { create } from 'zustand'
import { persist } from 'zustand/middleware'
import { Contact } from '../types/newsletterTypes'

interface ContactState {
  contacts: Contact[]
  setContacts: (contacts: Contact[]) => void
  addContact: (contact: Contact) => void
  removeContact: (id: number) => void
}

export const useContactStore = create<ContactState>()(
  persist(
    (set, get) => ({
      contacts: [],
      setContacts: (contacts) => set({ contacts }),
      addContact: (contact) => set({ contacts: [...get().contacts, contact] }),
      removeContact: (id) => set({ contacts: get().contacts.filter(c => c.id !== id) }),
    }),
    { name: 'contact-store' }
  )
)
</action>

<action type="file" filePath="frontend/src/api/newsletterApi.ts">
import axios from 'axios'
import { Contact, Tag, Newsletter, Subscription } from '../types/newsletterTypes'

const API_URL = import.meta.env.VITE_API_URL || 'http://localhost:8006'

// CONTACTS
export const fetchContacts = async (): Promise<Contact[]> =>
  (await axios.get(`${API_URL}/contacts/`)).data

export const createContact = async (data: Partial<Contact>): Promise<Contact> =>
  (await axios.post(`${API_URL}/contacts/`, data)).data

export const deleteContact = async (id: number): Promise<void> =>
  (await axios.delete(`${API_URL}/contacts/${id}/`)).data

export const importContacts = async (file: File): Promise<Contact[]> => {
  const formData = new FormData()
  formData.append('file', file)
  return (await axios.post(`${API_URL}/contacts/import/`, formData)).data
}

// TAGS
export const fetchTags = async (): Promise<Tag[]> =>
  (await axios.get(`${API_URL}/tags/`)).data

export const createTag = async (data: Partial<Tag>): Promise<Tag> =>
  (await axios.post(`${API_URL}/tags/`, data)).data

export const deleteTag = async (id: number): Promise<void> =>
  (await axios.delete(`${API_URL}/tags/${id}/`)).data

// NEWSLETTERS
export const fetchNewsletters = async (): Promise<Newsletter[]> =>
  (await axios.get(`${API_URL}/newsletters/`)).data

export const createNewsletter = async (data: Partial<Newsletter>): Promise<Newsletter> =>
  (await axios.post(`${API_URL}/newsletters/`, data)).data

export const deleteNewsletter = async (id: number): Promise<void> =>
  (await axios.delete(`${API_URL}/newsletters/${id}/`)).data

// SUBSCRIPTIONS (public form)
export const subscribe = async (data: Partial<Contact>): Promise<Subscription> =>
  (await axios.post(`${API_URL}/subscribe/`, data)).data

// AUTH (admin)
export const register = async (email: string, password: string): Promise<{ access_token: string }> =>
  (await axios.post(`${API_URL}/auth/register/`, { email, password })).data

export const login = async (email: string, password: string): Promise<{ access_token: string }> =>
  (await axios.post(`${API_URL}/auth/login/`, { email, password })).data
</action>

import { ReactNode } from 'react'
import { Box, Flex, VStack, Heading, Button } from '@chakra-ui/react'
import { Link } from 'react-router-dom'

const sidebarLinks = [
  { label: 'Contacts', to: '/contacts' },
  { label: 'Tags', to: '/tags' },
  { label: 'Newsletters', to: '/newsletters' },
  { label: 'Archive', to: '/archive' },
  { label: 'Settings', to: '/settings' },
]

export default function DashboardLayout({ children }: { children: ReactNode }) {
  return (
    <Flex minH="100vh">
      <Box bg="brand.600" color="white" w="220px" py={8} px={4} boxShadow="md">
        <VStack spacing={6} align="stretch">
          <Heading size="md" mb={4} fontWeight="bold" letterSpacing="wide">
            Newsletter Admin
          </Heading>
          {sidebarLinks.map(link => (
            <Button
              key={link.to}
              as={Link}
              to={link.to}
              variant="ghost"
              colorScheme="whiteAlpha"
              justifyContent="flex-start"
              fontWeight="bold"
              fontSize="lg"
              _hover={{ bg: 'brand.500', color: 'white' }}
              px={2}
            >
              {link.label}
            </Button>
          ))}
        </VStack>
      </Box>
      <Box flex="1" p={8} bg="gray.50">
        {children}
      </Box>
    </Flex>
  )
}

import { Navigate, Route, BrowserRouter as Router, Routes } from 'react-router-dom'
import { ProtectedRoute } from './components/protected-route'
import HomePage from './pages/HomePage'
import LoginPage from './pages/LoginPage'
import ProfilePage from './pages/ProfilePage'
import SettingsPage from './pages/SettingsPage'
import SignupPage from './pages/SignupPage'

/**
 * CHAKRA UI BOILERPLATE APP COMPONENT WITH AUTHENTICATION
 * 
 * This is a sample React application with protected routes and authentication.
 * Features included:
 * - Chakra UI component library for styling
 * - Zustand store for state management
 * - Protected routes with authentication
 * - Login/Signup pages
 * - Sample protected pages (Home, Profile, Settings)
 * - Persistent auth state with localStorage
 */
function App() {
  return (
    <Router>
      <Routes>
        {/* Public routes */}
        <Route path="/login" element={<LoginPage />} />
        <Route path="/signup" element={<SignupPage />} />

        {/* Protected routes */}
        <Route path="/" element={
          <ProtectedRoute>
            <HomePage />
          </ProtectedRoute>
        } />
        <Route path="/settings" element={
          <ProtectedRoute>
            <SettingsPage />
          </ProtectedRoute>
        } />
        <Route path="/profile" element={
          <ProtectedRoute>
            <ProfilePage />
          </ProtectedRoute>
        } />

        {/* Redirect any unknown routes to home */}
        <Route path="*" element={<Navigate to="/" replace />} />
      </Routes>
    </Router>
  )
}

export default App

            </ProtectedRoute>
          }
        />
        <Route
          path="/profile"
          element={
            <ProtectedRoute>
              <DashboardLayout>
                <ProfilePage />
              </DashboardLayout>
            </ProtectedRoute>
          }
        />

        {/* Redirect root to contacts */}
        <Route path="/" element={<Navigate to="/contacts" replace />} />

        {/* Redirect any unknown routes to contacts */}
        <Route path="*" element={<Navigate to="/contacts" replace />} />
      </Routes>
    </Router>
  )
}

export default App
</action>

<action type="file" filePath="backend/services/contact_service.py">
from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException, status, UploadFile, File
from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
from db_config import get_db
from database.contact import Contact
from database.tag import Tag
from models.newsletter_models import ContactCreate, ContactRead
from typing import List
import csv
from io import StringIO

router = APIRouter(prefix="/contacts", tags=["contacts"])

@router.post("/", response_model=ContactRead)
def create_contact(contact: ContactCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    print("Creating contact:", contact.email)
    db_contact = Contact(email=contact.email, name=contact.name, status=contact.status)
    if contact.tags:
        db_contact.tags = db.query(Tag).filter(Tag.id.in_(contact.tags)).all()
    db.add(db_contact)
    db.commit()
    db.refresh(db_contact)
    return db_contact

@router.get("/", response_model=List[ContactRead])
def list_contacts(db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    print("Listing contacts")
    return db.query(Contact).all()

@router.post("/import/", response_model=List[ContactRead])
def import_contacts(file: UploadFile = File(...), db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    print("Importing contacts from CSV")
    content = file.file.read().decode("utf-8")
    f = StringIO(content)
    reader = csv.DictReader(f)
    imported = []
    for row in reader:
        email = row.get("email")
        name = row.get("name")
        if not email:
            continue
        contact = Contact(email=email, name=name)
        db.add(contact)
        imported.append(contact)
    db.commit()
    for c in imported:
        db.refresh(c)
    return imported

@router.get("/{contact_id}/", response_model=ContactRead)
def get_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    contact = db.query(Contact).filter(Contact.id == contact_id).first()
    if not contact:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Contact not found")
    return contact

@router.delete("/{contact_id}/", status_code=status.HTTP_204_NO_CONTENT)
def delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    contact = db.query(Contact).filter(Contact.id == contact_id).first()
    if not contact:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Contact not found")
    db.delete(contact)
    db.commit()
    print("Deleted contact:", contact_id)
    return
</action>

<action type="file" filePath="backend/services/auth_service.py">
from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException, status
from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
from db_config import get_db
from database.user import User
from models.newsletter_models import ContactRead
from pydantic import BaseModel
from typing import Optional
from passlib.context import CryptContext
from jose import jwt, JWTError
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
import os

SECRET_KEY = os.environ.get("SECRET_KEY", "supersecretkey")
ALGORITHM = "HS256"
ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRE_MINUTES = 60

pwd_context = CryptContext(schemes=["bcrypt"], deprecated="auto")
router = APIRouter(prefix="/auth", tags=["auth"])

class UserCreate(BaseModel):
    email: str
    password: str

class UserLogin(BaseModel):
    email: str
    password: str

class Token(BaseModel):
    access_token: str
    token_type: str

def verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password):
    return pwd_context.verify(plain_password, hashed_password)

def get_password_hash(password):
    return pwd_context.hash(password)

def create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: Optional[timedelta] = None):
    to_encode = data.copy()
    expire = datetime.utcnow() + (expires_delta or timedelta(minutes=ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRE_MINUTES))
    to_encode.update({"exp": expire})
    return jwt.encode(to_encode, SECRET_KEY, algorithm=ALGORITHM)

@router.post("/register/", response_model=Token)
def register(user: UserCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    db_user = db.query(User).filter(User.email == user.email).first()
    if db_user:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=400, detail="Email already registered")
    hashed_password = get_password_hash(user.password)
    new_user = User(email=user.email, hashed_password=hashed_password)
    db.add(new_user)
    db.commit()
    db.refresh(new_user)
    access_token = create_access_token(data={"sub": new_user.email})
    return Token(access_token=access_token, token_type="bearer")

@router.post("/login/", response_model=Token)
def login(user: UserLogin, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    db_user = db.query(User).filter(User.email == user.email).first()
    if not db_user or not verify_password(user.password, db_user.hashed_password):
        raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail="Invalid credentials")
    access_token = create_access_token(data={"sub": db_user.email})
    return Token(access_token=access_token, token_type="bearer")

    password: str

class Token(BaseModel):
    access_token: str
    token_type: str

def verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password):
    return pwd_context.verify(plain_password, hashed_password)

def get_password_hash(password):
    return pwd_context.hash(password)

def create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: Optional[timedelta] = None):
    to_encode = data.copy()
    expire = datetime.utcnow() + (expires_delta or timedelta(minutes=ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRE_MINUTES))
    to_encode.update({"exp": expire})
    return jwt.encode(to_encode, SECRET_KEY, algorithm=ALGORITHM)

@router.post("/register/", response_model=Token)
def register(user: UserCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    db_user = db.query(User).filter(User.email == user.email).first()
    if db_user:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=400, detail="Email already registered")
    hashed_password = get_password_hash(user.password)
    new_user = User(email=user.email, hashed_password=hashed_password)
    db.add(new_user)
    db.commit()
    db.refresh(new_user)
    access_token = create_access_token(data={"sub": new_user.email})
    return Token(access_token=access_token, token_type="bearer")

@router.post("/login/", response_model=Token)
def login(user: UserLogin, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    db_user = db.query(User).filter(User.email == user.email).first()
    if not db_user or not verify_password(user.password, db_user.hashed_password):
        raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail="Invalid credentials")
    access_token = create_access_token(data={"sub": db_user.email})
    return Token(access_token=access_token, token_type="bearer")
</action>Now registering the authentication router in `backend/services/__init__.py` so the endpoints are available in the FastAPI app.

import { create } from 'zustand'
import { persist } from 'zustand/middleware'
import { Contact } from '../types/newsletterTypes'

interface ContactState {
  contacts: Contact[]
  setContacts: (contacts: Contact[]) => void
  addContact: (contact: Contact) => void
  removeContact: (id: number) => void
}

export const useContactStore = create<ContactState>()(
  persist(
    (set, get) => ({
      contacts: [],
      setContacts: (contacts) => set({ contacts }),
      addContact: (contact) => set({ contacts: [...get().contacts, contact] }),
      removeContact: (id) => set({ contacts: get().contacts.filter(c => c.id !== id) }),
    }),
    { name: 'contact-store' }
  )
)
</action>

import axios from 'axios'
import { Contact, Tag, Newsletter, Subscription } from '../types/newsletterTypes'

const API_URL = import.meta.env.VITE_API_URL || 'http://localhost:8006'

// CONTACTS
export const fetchContacts = async (): Promise<Contact[]> =>
  (await axios.get(`${API_URL}/contacts/`)).data

export const createContact = async (data: Partial<Contact>): Promise<Contact> =>
  (await axios.post(`${API_URL}/contacts/`, data)).data

export const deleteContact = async (id: number): Promise<void> =>
  (await axios.delete(`${API_URL}/contacts/${id}/`)).data

export const importContacts = async (file: File): Promise<Contact[]> => {
  const formData = new FormData()
  formData.append('file', file)
  return (await axios.post(`${API_URL}/contacts/import/`, formData)).data
}

// TAGS
export const fetchTags = async (): Promise<Tag[]> =>
  (await axios.get(`${API_URL}/tags/`)).data

export const createTag = async (data: Partial<Tag>): Promise<Tag> =>
  (await axios.post(`${API_URL}/tags/`, data)).data

export const deleteTag = async (id: number): Promise<void> =>
  (await axios.delete(`${API_URL}/tags/${id}/`)).data

// NEWSLETTERS
export const fetchNewsletters = async (): Promise<Newsletter[]> =>
  (await axios.get(`${API_URL}/newsletters/`)).data

export const createNewsletter = async (data: Partial<Newsletter>): Promise<Newsletter> =>
  (await axios.post(`${API_URL}/newsletters/`, data)).data

export const deleteNewsletter = async (id: number): Promise<void> =>
  (await axios.delete(`${API_URL}/newsletters/${id}/`)).data

// SUBSCRIPTIONS (public form)
export const subscribe = async (data: Partial<Contact>): Promise<Subscription> =>
  (await axios.post(`${API_URL}/subscribe/`, data)).data

// AUTH (admin)
export const register = async (email: string, password: string): Promise<{ access_token: string }> =>
  (await axios.post(`${API_URL}/auth/register/`, { email, password })).data

export const login = async (email: string, password: string): Promise<{ access_token: string }> =>
  (await axios.post(`${API_URL}/auth/login/`, { email, password })).data

<action type="file" filePath="frontend/src/pages/ContactsPage.tsx">
import { useEffect, useState } from 'react'
import {
  Box, Heading, Button, Table, Thead, Tbody, Tr, Th, Td, Tag, Spinner, Input, Flex,
} from '@chakra-ui/react'
import { useContactStore } from '../stores/contactStore'
import { useTagStore } from '../stores/tagStore'
import { fetchContacts, importContacts } from '../api/newsletterApi'
import { Contact } from '../types/newsletterTypes'

export default function ContactsPage() {
  const { contacts, setContacts } = useContactStore()
  const { tags } = useTagStore()
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false)
  const [importing, setImporting] = useState(false)

  useEffect(() => {
    setLoading(true)
    fetchContacts()
      .then(setContacts)
      .finally(() => setLoading(false))
  }, [setContacts])

  const handleImport = async (e: React.ChangeEvent<HTMLInputElement>) => {
    if (!e.target.files?.[0]) return
    setImporting(true)
    try {
      const imported = await importContacts(e.target.files[0])
      setContacts(imported)
    } finally {
      setImporting(false)
    }
  }

  return (
    <Box>
      <Flex align="center" justify="space-between" mb={6}>
        <Heading size="lg">Contacts</Heading>
        <Button as="label" htmlFor="import-csv" colorScheme="accent" variant="solid" isLoading={importing}>
          Import CSV
        </Button>
        <Input
          id="import-csv"
          type="file"
          accept=".csv"
          display="none"
          onChange={handleImport}
        />
      </Flex>
      {loading ? (
        <Spinner size="xl" />
      ) : (
        <Table variant="simple" bg="white" borderRadius="md" boxShadow="sm">
          <Thead>
            <Tr>
              <Th>Email</Th>
              <Th>Name</Th>
              <Th>Tags</Th>
              <Th>Status</Th>
            </Tr>
          </Thead>
          <Tbody>
            {contacts.map((contact: Contact) => (
              <Tr key={contact.id}>
                <Td>{contact.email}</Td>
                <Td>{contact.name}</Td>
                <Td>
                  {contact.tags?.map(tag => (
                    <Tag key={tag.id} colorScheme="gold" mr={2}>{tag.name}</Tag>
                  ))}
                </Td>
                <Td>{contact.status}</Td>
              </Tr>
            ))}
          </Tbody>
        </Table>
      )}
    </Box>
  )
}

import { useEffect, useState } from 'react'
import {
  Box, Heading, Button, Table, Thead, Tbody, Tr, Th, Td, Input, Flex, Tag as ChakraTag, Spinner,
} from '@chakra-ui/react'
import { useTagStore } from '../stores/tagStore'
import { fetchTags, createTag, deleteTag } from '../api/newsletterApi'
import { Tag } from '../types/newsletterTypes'

export default function TagsPage() {
  const { tags, setTags, addTag, removeTag } = useTagStore()
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false)
  const [newTag, setNewTag] = useState('')
  const [color, setColor] = useState('#FFD700')
  const [creating, setCreating] = useState(false)

  useEffect(() => {
    setLoading(true)
    fetchTags()
      .then(setTags)
      .finally(() => setLoading(false))
  }, [setTags])

  const handleCreate = async () => {
    if (!newTag.trim()) return
    setCreating(true)
    try {
      const tag = await createTag({ name: newTag, color })
      addTag(tag)
      setNewTag('')
    } finally {
      setCreating(false)
    }
  }

  const handleDelete = async (id: number) => {
    await deleteTag(id)
    removeTag(id)
  }

  return (
    <Box>
      <Flex align="center" justify="space-between" mb={6}>
        <Heading size="lg">Tags</Heading>
        <Flex gap={2}>
          <Input
            placeholder="Tag name"
            value={newTag}
            onChange={e => setNewTag(e.target.value)}
            width="150px"
          />
          <Input
            type="color"
            value={color}
            onChange={e => setColor(e.target.value)}
            width="40px"
            p={0}
          />
          <Button colorScheme="gold" onClick={handleCreate} isLoading={creating}>
            Add Tag
          </Button>
        </Flex>
      </Flex>
      {loading ? (
        <Spinner size="xl" />
      ) : (
        <Table variant="simple" bg="white" borderRadius="md" boxShadow="sm">
          <Thead>
            <Tr>
              <Th>Name</Th>
              <Th>Color</Th>
              <Th>Actions</Th>
            </Tr>
          </Thead>
          <Tbody>
            {tags.map((tag: Tag) => (
              <Tr key={tag.id}>
                <Td>
                  <ChakraTag bg={tag.color} color="black" px={3} py={1} borderRadius="full">
                    {tag.name}
                  </ChakraTag>
                </Td>
                <Td>
                  <Box w="24px" h="24px" bg={tag.color} borderRadius="md" border="1px solid #ddd" />
                </Td>
                <Td>
                  <Button size="sm" colorScheme="red" onClick={() => handleDelete(tag.id)}>
                    Delete
                  </Button>
                </Td>
              </Tr>
            ))}
          </Tbody>
        </Table>
      )}
    </Box>
  )
}

import { useEffect, useState } from 'react'
import {
  Box, Heading, Button, Table, Thead, Tbody, Tr, Th, Td, Spinner, Flex, Input, Textarea,
  useToast,
} from '@chakra-ui/react'
import { useNewsletterStore } from '../stores/newsletterStore'
import { fetchNewsletters, createNewsletter } from '../api/newsletterApi'
import { Newsletter } from '../types/newsletterTypes'

export default function NewslettersPage() {
  const { newsletters, setNewsletters, addNewsletter } = useNewsletterStore()
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false)
  const [creating, setCreating] = useState(false)
  const [subject, setSubject] = useState('')
  const [content, setContent] = useState('')
  const toast = useToast()

  useEffect(() => {
    setLoading(true)
    fetchNewsletters()
      .then(setNewsletters)
      .finally(() => setLoading(false))
  }, [setNewsletters])

  const handleCreate = async () => {
    if (!subject.trim() || !content.trim()) return
    setCreating(true)
    try {
      const newsletter = await createNewsletter({ subject, content })
      addNewsletter(newsletter)
      setSubject('')
      setContent('')
      toast({ title: 'Newsletter created!', status: 'success' })
    } finally {
      setCreating(false)
    }
  }

  return (
    <Box>
      <Heading size="lg" mb={6}>Newsletters</Heading>
      <Box mb={8} bg="white" p={6} borderRadius="md" boxShadow="sm">
        <Heading size="md" mb={4}>Create Newsletter</Heading>
        <Flex direction="column" gap={3}>
          <Input
            placeholder="Subject"
            value={subject}
            onChange={e => setSubject(e.target.value)}
          />
          <Textarea
            placeholder="Write your email content (HTML supported)"
            value={content}
            onChange={e => setContent(e.target.value)}
            minH="120px"
          />
          <Button colorScheme="brand" onClick={handleCreate} isLoading={creating}>
            Save Newsletter
          </Button>
        </Flex>
      </Box>
      {loading ? (
        <Spinner size="xl" />
      ) : (
        <Table variant="simple" bg="white" borderRadius="md" boxShadow="sm">
          <Thead>
            <Tr>
              <Th>Subject</Th>
              <Th>Status</Th>
              <Th>Created At</Th>
            </Tr>
          </Thead>
          <Tbody>
            {newsletters.map((n: Newsletter) => (
              <Tr key={n.id}>
                <Td>{n.subject}</Td>
                <Td>{n.status}</Td>
                <Td>{n.created_at?.slice(0, 10)}</Td>
              </Tr>
            ))}
          </Tbody>
        </Table>
      )}
    </Box>
  )
}

<action type="file" filePath="frontend/src/pages/SubscribePage.tsx">
import { useState } from 'react'
import {
  Box, Heading, Input, Button, VStack, Text, useToast,
} from '@chakra-ui/react'
import { subscribe } from '../api/newsletterApi'

export default function SubscribePage() {
  const [email, setEmail] = useState('')
  const [name, setName] = useState('')
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false)
  const [success, setSuccess] = useState(false)
  const toast = useToast()

  const handleSubscribe = async () => {
    if (!email.trim()) {
      toast({ title: 'Email is required.', status: 'error' })
      return
    }
    setLoading(true)
    try {
      await subscribe({ email, name })
      setSuccess(true)
      setEmail('')
      setName('')
      toast({ title: 'Subscribed successfully!', status: 'success' })
    } catch {
      toast({ title: 'Subscription failed.', status: 'error' })
    } finally {
      setLoading(false)
    }
  }

  return (
    <Box maxW="400px" mx="auto" mt={16} p={8} bg="white" borderRadius="md" boxShadow="md">
      <VStack spacing={6}>
        <Heading size="lg">Subscribe to Our Newsletter</Heading>
        {success && <Text color="green.600">Thank you for subscribing!</Text>}
        <Input
          placeholder="Your email"
          value={email}
          onChange={e => setEmail(e.target.value)}
          type="email"
        />
        <Input
          placeholder="Your name (optional)"
          value={name}
          onChange={e => setName(e.target.value)}
        />
        <Button colorScheme="brand" onClick={handleSubscribe} isLoading={loading}>
          Subscribe
        </Button>
      </VStack>
    </Box>
  )
}
</action>Now I will add the public subscription form route to the app so users can access it directly (e.g., `/subscribe`). This will make it easy to share or embed.

<action type="file" filePath="frontend/src/pages/ArchivePage.tsx">
import { useEffect, useState } from 'react'
import { Box, Heading, Table, Thead, Tbody, Tr, Th, Td, Spinner } from '@chakra-ui/react'
import { useNewsletterStore } from '../stores/newsletterStore'
import { fetchNewsletters } from '../api/newsletterApi'
import { Newsletter } from '../types/newsletterTypes'

export default function ArchivePage() {
  const { newsletters, setNewsletters } = useNewsletterStore()
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false)

  useEffect(() => {
    setLoading(true)
    fetchNewsletters()
      .then(setNewsletters)
      .finally(() => setLoading(false))
  }, [setNewsletters])

  const sentNewsletters = newsletters.filter(n => n.status === 'sent')

  return (
    <Box>
      <Heading size="lg" mb={6}>Archive</Heading>
      {loading ? (
        <Spinner size="xl" />
      ) : (
        <Table variant="simple" bg="white" borderRadius="md" boxShadow="sm">
          <Thead>
            <Tr>
              <Th>Subject</Th>
              <Th>Sent At</Th>
            </Tr>
          </Thead>
          <Tbody>
            {sentNewsletters.length === 0 ? (
              <Tr>
                <Td colSpan={2}>No sent newsletters yet.</Td>
              </Tr>
            ) : (
              sentNewsletters.map((n: Newsletter) => (
                <Tr key={n.id}>
                  <Td>{n.subject}</Td>
                  <Td>{n.sent_at?.slice(0, 10) || '-'}</Td>
                </Tr>
              ))
            )}
          </Tbody>
        </Table>
      )}
    </Box>
  )
}
